name: Jacob Garretson v. James Stuart Brown, Administrator of the Estate of John H. Brown, deceased. Thomas F. Blakemore and John Brown, Administrator d. b. n. c. t. a. of the Estate of James Brown, deceased, Appellant

judges: Before Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: Jacob Garretson v. James Stuart Brown, Administrator of the Estate of John H. Brown, deceased. Thomas F. Blakemore and John Brown, Administrator d. b. n. c. t. a. of the Estate of James Brown, deceased, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Pee Cueiam,
The decree of the court below is affirmed upon the findings of fact and conclusions of law contained in the master’s report.
Decree affirmed and appeal dismissed at the cost of the appellant.
opinions.author: Pee Cueiam,

attorneys: E. Sunn, Jr., and John Gf. Johnson, for appellant..
casebody.head_matter:
Jacob Garretson v. James Stuart Brown, Administrator of the Estate of John H. Brown, deceased. Thomas F. Blakemore and John Brown, Administrator d. b. n. c. t. a. of the Estate of James Brown, deceased, Appellant.
Argued March 30, 1898.
Appeal, No. 474, Jan. T., 1897, by James Stuart Brown, administrator, etc., one of the defendants, from order of C. P. No. 3, Pliila. Co., Dec. Term, 1882, No. 709, dismissing exceptions to auditor’s report.
Before Green, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Affirmed.
The facts appear by the last preceding case.
E. Sunn, Jr., and John Gf. Johnson, for appellant..
D. Stuart .Robinson, for appellee.
April 11, 1898:
